alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Charleston; Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 01 at 9:18PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley, Charleston and Colleton. * WHEN...Until midnight EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 908 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - The heaviest rain has fallen across the Johns Island and Wadmalaw Island area. Several public rain gauges have measured 4 to 7 inches of rain, with 3 to 5 inches of that falling since about 7 pm. Flooding is expected to be ongoing across Johns Island and Wadmalaw Island. Further to the east, rainfall has not been as heavy across West Ashley, James Island, Downtown Charleston, and Mount Pleasant where 1 to 3 inches has fallen since 7 pm. However, high tide will occur around 1030 pm and should peak close to the minor flood level for coastal flooding. With rain ongoing and the tide rising, flooding will expand across Downtown Charleston and surrounding areas. Rainfall is expected to continue through midnight. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, Edisto Beach, Johns Island, James Island, West Ashley, Downtown Charleston, Fort Sumter, Daniel Island, Hollywood, Isle Of Palms, Folly Beach, Ravenel, Sullivan`s Island, Seabrook Island, Kiawah Island, Meggett, Rockville, Maybank Bridge and James Island County Park.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
